main event: Four Air Force personnel observed bright metallic cylindrical objects flying near Keesler Air Force Base, Mississippi, on 7 May 1952.
interesting points: The objects were observed for about 5-10 minutes before disappearing for five minutes., A total of ten objects were estimated to be in the sky., The objects were described as aluminum or silver in color and cylindrical in shape., They flew at a speed of 600 to 800 miles per hour in a straight line., The observation was confirmed by the control tower.
